name: Define High-Level Goal
description: Clearly articulate and document the overarching objective that the system or project aims to achieve. This involves understanding the desired end-state, its purpose, and its significance.
purpose: Establish a clear and unified understanding of the ultimate aim.
applicability_notes: This is a universal first step in any project or initiative, regardless of domain. It sets the direction for all subsequent actions.
examples_of_usage: Defining the goal for a new software feature.
Stating the objective of a marketing campaign.
Articulating the mission of a non-profit organization.

name: Analyze Context
description: Gather and process all relevant background information, constraints, environmental factors, and existing conditions that pertain to the high-level goal. This includes understanding the current state and potential influencing factors.
purpose: Gain a comprehensive understanding of the environment and factors influencing the goal.
applicability_notes: Crucial for informed decision-making and strategy formulation. Applicable in strategic planning, problem-solving, and design processes.
examples_of_usage: Analyzing the competitive landscape before launching a product.
Assessing user needs and behaviors before designing an application.
Understanding regulatory requirements for a new policy.

name: Define Roles
description: Identify and assign specific responsibilities, authorities, and accountabilities to individuals or teams involved in achieving the high-level goal. This clarifies who is responsible for what.
purpose: Establish clear ownership and accountability for tasks and outcomes.
applicability_notes: Essential for project management, team collaboration, and operational efficiency across any structured endeavor.
examples_of_usage: Assigning tasks to team members in a software development project.
Defining roles in a committee responsible for an event.
Establishing a command structure in an emergency response scenario.
